short_description.title: Description for App: Magento. Do not translate "Magento."
short_description.value: Displays customer and order details from Magento.

long_description.title: Long Description for App: Magento. Do not translate "Magento."
long_description.value:
The Zendesk Support for Magento app works to unite your business with a dynamic two-way integration between Zendesk Support ticket data and Magento e-commerce data.

### Improve customer satisfaction with better conversations

* Manage all your customer interactions in one place, whether you have one Magento site or several driving efficiencies within your Support team.
* Get more visibility on relevant customer data from Magento, such as billing, shipping, and order info on Zendesk Support ticket pages and user profiles.
* Add Zendesk Support communication channels to any Magento-powered site so your customers can get in touch with your Support team wherever they are.

### Sync your teams for faster resolutions and higher revenues

* Easily collaborate to resolve customer issues faster with access to support ticket information in a custom Zendesk Support panel within Magento.
* Stay up-to-date on the account and the customer with a single view of support information next to critical sales statistics, customer profiles, and sales orders.
* Create and update Zendesk Support tickets directly in Magento for greater Support team efficiencies.

For complete setup instructions, see the [setup guide](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660046).

By enabling this app, You agree to the [Built by Zendesk Terms of Use](https://www.zendesk.com/company/built-by-zendesk-agmt/).

installation_instructions.title: Installation Instructions for App: Magento. Do not translate "Magento."
installation_instructions.value:
### Availability and Supported Versions

Zendesk Support for Magento is available at no cost to all Zendesk Support customers. Furthermore, this integration is supported on Magento Community 1.7+ and Enterprise 1.9+.

### Prerequisites

* Magento Community v1.7+ or Magento Enterprise v1.9+ with full administrator rights
* PHP 5.2

### How to install

The *Zendesk Support for Magento* setup has two parts.  First, sign in to your Zendesk Support account, then follow the [instructions here](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660046) to download the extension and learn how to configure the extension in Magento.  When this is complete, you are ready to add the *Magento App for Zendesk Support* to your account.

In Zendesk Support, click the Admin icon in the sidebar. Select Apps > Marketplace, then find the Magento app and click the tile. On the Magento app page, click Install app in the upper-right corner. Configure the app settings, then click Install:

* **Title**: Name for the application.
* **Store URL**: The URL to your Magneto store (for example, http://www.zendesk-store.com).
* **Store Code**: Add the default store code you use, if you have 'Add Store Code to Urls' set to 'Yes' on your Magento store.
* **Access token**: Your API access token from the Zendesk Support extension for Magento.
* **Order ID Field ID**: The Zendesk Support custom field ID you are using to store the associated Magento order number.

For complete instructions, see the [setup guide](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660066).

label.title: Label for the Magento Store URL
Label for the Magento Store Code. See for example: https://support.google.com/business/answer/4542487?hl=en

help_text.title: Helper text for the Magento Store Code. Do not translate "Magento."
help_text.value: Add the default store code you use, if you have 'Add Store Code to Urls' set to 'Yes' on your Magento store.

label.title: Label for the Magento Access token
Label for the Zendesk Order ID Field ID

customer_since.title: When the customer first became a customer

billing.title: The billing address of the customer

shipping.title: The shipping address of the customer

order.title: A title for the order section which displays details about the order

guest.title: If a customer if a guest of the store

message.title: Please try the previous action again
message.value: Please try the previous action again.

server.title: An error occurred while communicating with the Magento server
server.value: The request failed. Please ensure your configuration is correct and try again.

data.title: An error occurred while reading the ticket
data.value: Ticket data could not be read.

noprofile.title: Error message displayed when the customer doesn't exist

loading.title: Details about the customer are loading
loading.value: Waiting for ticket data to load...

requesting.title: Data is being requested from Magento. Do not translate "Magento."

id.title: Recent orders the customer has completed

status.title: The status of the recent orders
The current status of the order

store.title: Which store the order was placed through

total.title: The total amount of the order

message.title: Data is being requested from Magento

no_address.title: No address is present for that user

pending.title: Pending orders are brand new orders that have not been processed.

processing.title: Processing orders are orders that have been assigned an invoice.

pending_payment.title: Pending Payment orders are brand new orders that have not been cleared by a payment gateway.

payment_review.title: Payment Review means that the order is currently under review on the payment gateway.

suspected_fraud.title: Suspected Fraud means that the order has been flagged by Magento as possible fraud.

holded.title: On Hold means no further action can be done on the order until it is taken off hold.

complete.title: Orders marked as complete have been invoiced and have shipped.

closed.title: Closed orders are orders that have had a credit memo assigned to it and the customer has been refunded.

canceled.title: Cancelled order. Order that has been cancelled such as if the order has not been paid for (singular).

paypal_reversed.title: Status specific for Paypal processed orders which has been reversed and refunded.

paypal_canceled_reversal.title: Status specific for Paypal processed orders which has been reversed but subsequently reprocessed.

pending_paypal.title: Status specific for Paypal processed orders which has been set to pending on Paypal's System.
